classes.name: Client
classes.description: The starting point for making a Discord Bot.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the client

methods.name: login
methods.description:
Logs the client in. If successful, resolves with the account's token. <warn>If you're making a bot, it's
much better to use a bot account rather than a user account.
Bot accounts have higher rate limits and have access to some features user accounts don't have. User bots
that are making a lot of API requests can even be banned.</warn>

params.name: emailOrToken
params.description:
The email or token used for the account. If it is an email, a password _must_ be
provided.

params.name: password
params.description: The password for the account, only needed if an email was provided.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys the client and logs out.

methods.name: syncGuilds
methods.description:
This shouldn't really be necessary to most developers as it is automatically invoked every 30 seconds, however
if you wish to force a sync of Guild data, you can use this. Only applicable to user accounts.

params.name: guilds
params.description: An array of guilds to sync

methods.name: fetchUser
methods.description:
Caches a user, or obtains it from the cache if it's already cached.
If the user isn't already cached, it will only be obtainable by OAuth bot accounts.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the user to obtain

properties.name: users
properties.description: A Collection of the Client's stored users

properties.name: guilds
properties.description: A Collection of the Client's stored guilds

properties.name: channels
properties.description: A Collection of the Client's stored channels

properties.name: token
properties.description: The authorization token for the logged in user/bot.

properties.name: user
properties.description: The ClientUser representing the logged in Client

properties.name: email
properties.description: The email, if there is one, for the logged in Client

properties.name: password
properties.description: The password, if there is one, for the logged in Client

properties.name: readyTime
properties.description: The date at which the Client was regarded as being in the `READY` state.

properties.name: voiceConnections
properties.description: Returns a Collection, mapping Guild ID to Voice Connections.

properties.name: uptime
properties.description: The uptime for the logged in Client.

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change.

params.name: oldChannel
params.description: The channel before the update

params.name: newChannel
params.description: The channel after the update

events.name: guildUnavailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes unavailable, likely due to a server outage.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that has become unavailable.

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the member has left.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has left the guild.

events.name: guildRoleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is created.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the role was created in.

params.name: role
params.description: The role that was created.

events.name: guildRoleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the role was deleted in.

params.name: role
params.description: The role that was deleted.

events.name: guildRoleUpdated
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the role was updated in.

params.name: oldRole
params.description: The role before the update.

params.name: newRole
params.description: The role after the update.

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

params.name: oldGuild
params.description: The guild before the update.

params.name: newGuild
params.description: The guild after the update.

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

params.name: oldMessage
params.description: The message before the update.

params.name: newMessage
params.description: The message after the update.

events.name: userUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a detail of the logged in User changes - e.g. username.

params.name: oldClientUser
params.description: The client user before the update.

params.name: newClientUser
params.description: The client user after the update.

events.name: guildCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client joins a Guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The created guild

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a Channel is created.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was created

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a Channel is deleted.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that was deleted

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever the pins of a Channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event, not much information
can be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occured in

params.name: time
params.description: The time of the pins update

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the ban occurred in

params.name: user
params.description: The user that was banned

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the unban occurred in

params.name: user
params.description: The user that was unbanned

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a Guild is deleted/left.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that was deleted

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of Guild members is received

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the chunks relate to

params.name: members
params.description: The members in the chunk

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created

params.name: message
params.description: The created message

events.name: messageDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is deleted

params.name: message
params.description: The deleted message

events.name: messageDeleteBulk
events.description: Emitted whenever messages are deleted in bulk

params.name: messages
params.description: The deleted messages, mapped by their ID

events.name: presenceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user changes one of their details or starts/stop playing a game

params.name: oldUser
params.description: The user before the presence update

params.name: newUser
params.description: The user after the presence update

events.name: guildMemberAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a member becomes available in a large Guild

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the member became available in

params.name: member
params.description: The member that became available

events.name: typingStart
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts typing in a channel

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user started typing in

params.name: user
params.description: The user that started typing

events.name: typingStop
events.description: Emitted whenever a user stops typing in a channel

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user stopped typing in

params.name: user
params.description: The user that stopped typing

events.name: voiceStateUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user changes voice state - e.g. joins/leaves a channel, mutes/unmutes.

params.name: oldMember
params.description: The member before the voice state update

params.name: newMember
params.description: The member after the voice state update

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted whenever the Client encounters a serious connection error

params.name: error
params.description: The encountered error

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the Client becomes ready to start working

events.name: reconnecting
events.description: Emitted when the Client tries to reconnect after being disconnected

events.name: guildMemberAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a user joins a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the user has joined

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has joined

events.name: guildMemberUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a Guild Member changes - i.e. new role, removed role, nickname

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the update affects

params.name: oldMember
params.description: The member before the update

params.name: newMember
params.description: The member after the update

events.name: guildMemberSpeaking
events.description: Emitted once a Guild Member starts/stops speaking

params.name: member
params.description: The member that started/stopped speaking

params.name: speaking
params.description: Whether or not the member is speaking

classes.name: StreamDispatcher

methods.name: end
methods.description: Stops the current stream permanently and emits an `end` event.

methods.name: setVolume
methods.description: Sets the volume relative to the input stream - i.e. 1 is normal, 0.5 is half, 2 is double.

params.name: volume
params.description: The volume that you want to set

methods.name: setVolumeDecibels
methods.description: Set the volume in decibels

params.name: db
params.description: The decibels

methods.name: setVolumeLogarithmic
methods.description: Set the volume so that a perceived value of 0.5 is half the perceived volume etc.

params.name: value
params.description: The value for the volume

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Stops sending voice packets to the voice connection (stream may still progress however)

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resumes sending voice packets to the voice connection (may be further on in the stream than when paused)

properties.name: volume
properties.description: The volume of the stream, relative to the stream's input volume

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted when the dispatcher starts/stops speaking

params.name: value
params.description: Whether or not the dispatcher is speaking

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted once the stream has ended. Attach a `once` listener to this.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted once the stream has encountered an error. Attach a `once` listener to this. Also emits `end`.

params.name: err
params.description: The encountered error

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted when the stream wants to give debug information.

params.name: information
params.description: The debug information

classes.name: VoiceReceiver

methods.name: createOpusStream
methods.description:
Creates a readable stream for a user that provides opus data while the user is speaking. When the user
stops speaking, the stream is destroyed.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to create the stream for

methods.name: createPCMStream
methods.description:
Creates a readable stream for a user that provides PCM data while the user is speaking. When the user
stops speaking, the stream is destroyed. The stream is 16-bit signed stereo PCM at 48KHz.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to create the stream for

properties.name: connection
properties.description: The VoiceConnection that instantiated this

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted whenever a voice packet cannot be decrypted

params.name: message
params.description: The warning message

events.name: opus
events.description: Emitted whenever voice data is received from the voice connection. This is _always_ emitted (unlike PCM).

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

params.name: buffer
params.description: The opus buffer

events.name: pcm
events.description:
Emits decoded voice data when it's received. For performance reasons, the decoding will only
happen if there is at least one `pcm` listener on this receiver.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

params.name: buffer
params.description: The decoded buffer

classes.name: VoiceConnection

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects the Client from the Voice Channel

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason of the disconnection

methods.name: playFile
methods.description: Play the given file in the voice connection

params.name: file
params.description: The path to the file

methods.name: playStream
methods.description: Plays and converts an audio stream in the voice connection

params.name: stream
params.description: The audio stream to play

methods.name: playConvertedStream
methods.description: Plays a stream of 16-bit signed stereo PCM at 48KHz.

params.name: stream
params.description: The audio stream to play.

methods.name: createReceiver
methods.description: Creates a VoiceReceiver so you can start listening to voice data. It's recommended to only create one of these.

properties.name: player
properties.description: The player

properties.name: endpoint
properties.description: The endpoint of the connection

properties.name: channel
properties.description: The VoiceChannel for this connection

properties.name: ready
properties.description: Whether or not the connection is ready

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted whenever the connection encounters a fatal error.

params.name: error
params.description: The encountered error

events.name: disconnected
events.description: Emit once the voice connection has disconnected.

params.name: error
params.description: The encountered error, if any

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted once the connection is ready (joining voice channels resolves when the connection is ready anyway)

events.name: speaking
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts/stops speaking

params.name: user
params.description: The user that has started/stopped speaking

params.name: speaking
params.description: Whether or not the user is speaking

classes.name: Shard
classes.description: Represents a Shard spawned by the ShardingManager.

properties.name: manager
properties.description: The manager of the spawned shard

properties.name: id
properties.description: The shard id

properties.name: process
properties.description: The process of the shard

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description:
This is a utility class that can be used to help you spawn shards of your Client. Each shard is completely separate
from the other. The Shard Manager takes a path to a file and spawns it under the specified amount of shards safely.
<warn>The Sharding Manager is still experimental</warn>

params.name: file
params.description: the path to your file

params.name: totalShards
params.description: the number of shards you would like to spawn

properties.name: totalShards
properties.description: The amount of shards that this manager is going to spawn

properties.name: shards
properties.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned.

classes.name: Channel
classes.description: Represents any Channel on Discord

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples:
// delete the channel
channel.delete()
 .then() // success
 .catch(console.log); // log error

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of the channel, either:
* `dm` - a DM channel
* `group` - a Group DM channel
* `text` - a guild text channel
* `voice` - a guild voice channel

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the channel

classes.name: ClientUser
classes.description: Represents the logged in client's Discord User

methods.name: setUsername
methods.description:
Set the username of the logged in Client.
<info>Changing usernames in Discord is heavily rate limited, with only 2 requests
every hour. Use this sparingly!</info>

params.name: username
params.description: The new username

methods.name: setEmail
methods.description:
If this user is a "self bot" or logged in using a normal user's details (which should be avoided), you can set the
email here.

params.name: email
params.description: The new email

methods.name: setPassword
methods.description:
If this user is a "self bot" or logged in using a normal user's details (which should be avoided), you can set the
password here.

params.name: password
params.description: The new password

methods.name: setAvatar
methods.description: Set the avatar of the logged in Client.

params.name: avatar
params.description: The new avatar

methods.name: setStatus
methods.description: Set the status and playing game of the logged in client.

params.name: status
params.description: The status, can be `online` or `idle`

params.name: game
params.description: The game that is being played

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the User's mention instead of the User object.
examples:
// logs: Hello from <@123456789>!
console.log(`Hello from ${user}!`);

methods.name: deleteDM
methods.description: Deletes a DM Channel (if one exists) between the Client and the User. Resolves with the Channel if successful.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if the user is equal to another. It compares username, ID, discriminator, status and the game being played.
It is recommended to compare equality by using `user.id === user2.id` unless you want to compare all properties.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to compare

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: attachment
params.description: The file to send

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

properties.name: verified
properties.description: Whether or not this account has been verified

properties.name: email
properties.description: The email of this account

properties.name: username
properties.description: The username of the User

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the User

properties.name: discriminator
properties.description: A discriminator based on username for the User

properties.name: avatar
properties.description: The ID of the user's avatar

properties.name: bot
properties.description: Whether or not the User is a Bot.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
The status of the user:

* **`online`** - user is online
* **`offline`** - user is offline
* **`idle`** - user is AFK

properties.name: game
properties.description: The game that the user is playing, `null` if they aren't playing a game.

properties.name: avatarURL
properties.description: A link to the user's avatar (if they have one, otherwise null)

classes.name: DMChannel
classes.description: Represents a Direct Message Channel between two users.

methods.name: toString
methods.description:
When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the recipient's mention instead of the
DM channel object.

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk delete a given Collection or Array of messages in one go. Returns the deleted messages after.

params.name: messages
params.description: The messages to delete

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: attachment
params.description: The file to send

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// start typing in a channel
channel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// stop typing in a channel
channel.stopTyping();

// force typing to fully stop in a channel
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description:
Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specified
filter.

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter function to use

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples:
// delete the channel
channel.delete()
 .then() // success
 .catch(console.log); // log error

properties.name: recipient
properties.description: The recipient on the other end of the DM

properties.name: lastMessageID
properties.description: The ID of the last sent message, if available

properties.name: messages
properties.description: A Collection containing the messages sent to this channel.

properties.name: typing
properties.description: Whether or not the typing indicator is being shown in the channel.

properties.name: typingCount
properties.description: Number of times `startTyping` has been called.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of the channel, either:
* `dm` - a DM channel
* `group` - a Group DM channel
* `text` - a guild text channel
* `voice` - a guild voice channel

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the channel

classes.name: Emoji
classes.description: Represents a Custom Emoji

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the emoji mention rather than the object.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Client that instantiated this object

properties.name: guild
properties.description: The Guild this emoji is part of

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the Emoji

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the Emoji

properties.name: requiresColons
properties.description: Whether or not this emoji requires colons surrounding it

properties.name: managed
properties.description: Whether this emoji is managed by an external service

properties.name: roles
properties.description: A collection of roles this emoji is active for (empty if all), mapped by role ID.

properties.name: url
properties.description: The URL to the emoji file

classes.name: EvaluatedPermissions
classes.description: The final evaluated permissions for a member in a channel

methods.name: serialize
methods.description:
Get an object mapping permission name, e.g. `READ_MESSAGES` to a boolean - whether the user
can perform this or not.

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Checks whether the user has a certain permission, e.g. `READ_MESSAGES`.

params.name: permission
params.description: The permission to check for

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the user to explicitly have the exact permission

properties.name: member
properties.description: The member this permissions refer to

classes.name: GroupDMChannel
classes.description: Represents a Group DM on Discord

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk delete a given Collection or Array of messages in one go. Returns the deleted messages after.

params.name: messages
params.description: The messages to delete

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: attachment
params.description: The file to send

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// start typing in a channel
channel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// stop typing in a channel
channel.stopTyping();

// force typing to fully stop in a channel
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description:
Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specified
filter.

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter function to use

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples:
// delete the channel
channel.delete()
 .then() // success
 .catch(console.log); // log error

properties.name: recipients
properties.description: A collection of the recipients of this DM, mapped by their ID.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this Group DM, can be null if one isn't set.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of this Group DM Channel.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: A hash of the Group DM icon.

properties.name: lastMessageID
properties.description: The ID of the last message in the channel, if one was sent.

properties.name: owner
properties.description: The owner of this Group DM.

properties.name: messages
properties.description: A Collection containing the messages sent to this channel.

properties.name: typing
properties.description: Whether or not the typing indicator is being shown in the channel.

properties.name: typingCount
properties.description: Number of times `startTyping` has been called.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of the channel, either:
* `dm` - a DM channel
* `group` - a Group DM channel
* `text` - a guild text channel
* `voice` - a guild voice channel

classes.name: Guild
classes.description:
Represents a Guild (or a Server) on Discord.
<info>It's recommended to see if a guild is available before performing operations or reading data from it. You can
check this with `guild.available`.</info>

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the Guild's name instead of the Guild object.
examples:
// logs: Hello from My Guild!
console.log(`Hello from ${guild}!`);

// logs: Hello from My Guild!
console.log(`Hello from ' + guild + '!');

methods.name: member
methods.description: Returns the GuildMember form of a User object, if the User is present in the guild.
examples:
// get the guild member of a user
const member = guild.member(message.author);

params.name: user
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the GuildMember of

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Whether this Guild equals another Guild. It compares all properties, so for most operations
it is advisable to just compare `guild.id === guild2.id` as it is much faster and is often
what most users need.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to compare

methods.name: createChannel
methods.description: Creates a new Channel in the Guild.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new channel

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the new channel, either `text` or `voice`

methods.name: createRole
methods.description: Creates a new role in the guild, as of now this is just a blank role.

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Causes the Client to leave the guild.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Causes the Client to delete the guild.

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Updates the Guild with new information - e.g. a new name.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to update the guild with

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Edit the name of the Guild.

params.name: name
params.description: The new name of the Guild

methods.name: setRegion
methods.description: Edit the region of the Guild.

params.name: region
params.description: The new region of the guild.

methods.name: setVerificationLevel
methods.description: Edit the verification level of the Guild.

params.name: verificationLevel
params.description: The new verification level of the guild

methods.name: setAFKChannel
methods.description: Edit the AFK channel of the Guild.

params.name: afkChannel
params.description: The new AFK channel

methods.name: setAFKTimeout
methods.description: Edit the AFK timeout of the Guild.

params.name: afkTimeout
params.description: The time in seconds that a user must be idle to be considered AFK

methods.name: setIcon
methods.description: Set a new Guild Icon.

params.name: icon
params.description: The new icon of the guild

methods.name: setOwner
methods.description: Sets a new owner of the Guild.

params.name: owner
params.description: The new owner of the Guild

methods.name: setSplash
methods.description: Set a new Guild Splash Logo.

params.name: splash
params.description: The new splash screen of the guild

methods.name: unban
methods.description: Unbans a member from the Guild

params.name: member
params.description: The member to unban

methods.name: fetchBans
methods.description: Fetch a Collection of banned users in this Guild.

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description: Fetch a Collection of invites to this Guild. Resolves with a Collection mapping invites by their codes.

methods.name: fetchMembers
methods.description:
Fetches all the members in the Guild, even if they are offline. If the Guild has less than 250 members,
this should not be necessary.

params.name: query
params.description: An optional query to provide when fetching members

methods.name: sync
methods.description: Syncs this guild (already done automatically every 30 seconds). Only applicable to user accounts.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The Client that created the instance of the the Guild.

properties.name: members
properties.description: A Collection of members that are in this Guild. The key is the member's ID, the value is the member.

properties.name: channels
properties.description: A Collection of channels that are in this Guild. The key is the channel's ID, the value is the channel.

properties.name: roles
properties.description: A Collection of roles that are in this Guild. The key is the role's ID, the value is the role.

properties.name: available
properties.description: Whether the Guild is available to access. If it is not available, it indicates a server outage.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The Unique ID of the Guild, useful for comparisons.

properties.name: splash
properties.description: The hash of the guild splash image, or null if no splash (VIP only)

properties.name: region
properties.description: The region the guild is located in

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the guild

properties.name: memberCount
properties.description: The full amount of members in this Guild as of `READY`

properties.name: large
properties.description: Whether the guild is "large" (has more than 250 members)

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The hash of the guild icon, or null if there is no icon.

properties.name: features
properties.description: An array of guild features.

properties.name: emojis
properties.description: An array of guild emojis.

properties.name: afkTimeout
properties.description: The time in seconds before a user is counted as "away from keyboard".

properties.name: afkChannelID
properties.description: The ID of the voice channel where AFK members are moved.

properties.name: embedEnabled
properties.description: Whether embedded images are enabled on this guild.

properties.name: verificationLevel
properties.description: The verification level of the guild.

properties.name: joinDate
properties.description: The date at which the logged-in client joined the guild.

properties.name: iconURL
properties.description: Gets the URL to this guild's icon (if it has one, otherwise it returns null)

properties.name: owner
properties.description: The owner of the Guild

classes.name: GuildChannel
classes.description: Represents a Guild Channel (i.e. Text Channels and Voice Channels)

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.
In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to compare this channel to

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description:
Gets the overall set of permissions for a user in this channel, taking into account roles and permission
overwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the overall permissions for

methods.name: overwritePermissions
methods.description: Overwrites the permissions for a user or role in this channel.

params.name: userOrRole
params.description: The user or role to update

params.name: options
params.description: The configuration for the update

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set a new name for the Guild Channel

params.name: name
params.description: The new name for the guild channel

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set a new position for the Guild Channel

params.name: position
params.description: The new position for the guild channel

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Set a new topic for the Guild Channel

params.name: topic
params.description: The new topic for the guild channel

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the Channel's mention instead of the Channel object.
examples:
// Outputs: Hello from #general
console.log(`Hello from ${channel}`);

// Outputs: Hello from #general
console.log('Hello from ' + channel);

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Create an invite to this Guild Channel

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the invite

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the channel
examples:
// delete the channel
channel.delete()
 .then() // success
 .catch(console.log); // log error

properties.name: topic
properties.description: The topic of the Guild Channel, if there is one.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the channel in the list.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the Guild Channel

properties.name: permissionOverwrites
properties.description: A map of permission overwrites in this channel for roles and users.

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Channel

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of the channel, either:
* `dm` - a DM channel
* `group` - a Group DM channel
* `text` - a guild text channel
* `voice` - a guild voice channel

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the channel

classes.name: GuildMember

examples:
// ban a guild member
guildMember.ban(7);

params.name: deleteDays
params.description:
The amount of days worth of messages from this member that should
also be deleted. Between `0` and `7`.

properties.name: client

properties.name: guild
properties.description: The guild that this member is part of

properties.name: user
properties.description: The user that this guild member instance Represents

properties.name: serverDeaf
properties.description: Whether this member is deafened server-wide

properties.name: serverMute
properties.description: Whether this member is muted server-wide

properties.name: selfMute
properties.description: Whether this member is self-muted

properties.name: selfDeaf
properties.description: Whether this member is self-deafened

properties.name: voiceSessionID
properties.description: The voice session ID of this member, if any

properties.name: voiceChannelID
properties.description: The voice channel ID of this member, if any

properties.name: speaking
properties.description: Whether this meember is speaking

properties.name: nickname
properties.description: The nickname of this Guild Member, if they have one

properties.name: joinDate
properties.description: The date this member joined the guild

properties.name: roles
properties.description: A list of roles that are applied to this GuildMember, mapped by the role ID.

properties.name: mute
properties.description: Whether this member is muted in any way

properties.name: deaf
properties.description: Whether this member is deafened in any way

properties.name: voiceChannel
properties.description: The voice channel this member is in, if any

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of this User

classes.name: MessageCollector
classes.description: Collects messages based on a specified filter, then emits them.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to collect messages in

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter function

params.name: options
params.description: Options for the collector

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the collector and emits `end`.

params.name: reason
params.description: An optional reason for stopping the collector

properties.name: channel
properties.description: The channel this collector is operating on

properties.name: filter
properties.description: A function used to filter messages that the collector collects.

properties.name: options
properties.description: Options for the collecor.

properties.name: ended
properties.description: Whether this collector has stopped collecting Messages.

properties.name: collected
properties.description: A collection of collected messages, mapped by message ID.

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever the Collector receives a Message that passes the filter test.

params.name: message
params.description: The received message

params.name: collector
params.description: The collector the message passed through

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the Collector stops collecting.

params.name: collection
params.description:
A collection of messages collected
during the lifetime of the Collector, mapped by the ID of the Messages.

params.name: reason
params.description:
The reason for the end of the collector. If it ended because it reached the specified time
limit, this would be `time`. If you invoke `.stop()` without specifying a reason, this would be `user`. If it
ended because it reached its message limit, it will be `limit`.

classes.name: Invite
classes.description: Represents an Invitation to a Guild Channel

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this invite

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the invite

properties.name: maxAge
properties.description: The maximum age of the invite, in seconds

properties.name: code
properties.description: The code for this invite

properties.name: temporary
properties.description: Whether or not this invite is temporary

properties.name: uses
properties.description: How many times this invite has been used

properties.name: maxUses
properties.description: The maximum uses of this invite

properties.name: inviter
properties.description: The user who created this invite

properties.name: guild
properties.description:
The Guild the invite is for. If this Guild is already known, this will be a Guild object. If the Guild is
unknown, this will be a Partial Guild.

properties.name: channels
properties.description:
The Channel the invite is for. If this Channel is already known, this will be a GuildChannel object.
If the Channel is unknown, this will be a Partial Guild Channel.

properties.name: creationDate
properties.description: The creation date of the invite

classes.name: Message
classes.description: Represents a Message on Discord

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messages
without checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. This
method allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the message

params.name: timeout
params.description: How long to wait to delete the message in milliseconds

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edit the content of a message

params.name: content
params.description: The new content for the message

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Reply to a message

params.name: content
params.description: The content for the message

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Pins this message to the channel's pinned messages

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Unpins this message from the channel's pinned messages

properties.name: channel
properties.description: The channel that the message was sent in

properties.name: guild
properties.description: If the message was sent in a guild, this will be the guild the message was sent in

properties.name: client
properties.description: The client that instantiated the Message

properties.name: pinned
properties.description: Whether or not this message is pinned

properties.name: author
properties.description: The author of the message

properties.name: member
properties.description:
Represents the Author of the message as a Guild Member. Only available if the message comes from a Guild
where the author is still a member.

properties.name: content
properties.description: The content of the message

properties.name: tts
properties.description: Whether or not the message was Text-To-Speech

properties.name: nonce
properties.description: A random number used for checking message delivery

properties.name: embeds
properties.description: A list of embeds in the message - e.g. YouTube Player

properties.name: attachments
properties.description: A collection of attachments in the message - e.g. Pictures - mapped by their ID.

properties.name: mentions
properties.description: An object containing a further users, roles or channels collections

props.name: mentions.users
props.description: Mentioned users, maps their ID to the user object.

props.name: mentions.roles
props.description: Mentioned roles, maps their ID to the role object.

props.name: mentions.channels
props.description:
Mentioned channels,
maps their ID to the channel object.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the message (unique in the channel it was sent)

properties.name: system
properties.description: Whether or not this message was sent by Discord, not actually a user (e.g. pin notifications)

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: When the message was sent

properties.name: editedTimestamp
properties.description: If the message was edited, the timestamp at which it was last edited

classes.name: MessageAttachment
classes.description: Represents an Attachment in a Message

properties.name: filesize

properties.name: url

properties.name: proxyURL

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of this attachment (if an image)

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of this attachment (if an image)

methods.description: Deletes the role

methods.description: Set a new color for the role

params.description: The new color for the role, either a hex string or a base 10 number

params.description: The permissions of the role

methods.description: Get an object mapping permission names to whether or not the role enables that permission
examples:
// print the serialized role
console.log(role.serialize());

methods.description: Whether or not the role includes the given permission

params.description: Whether to require the role to explicitly have the exact permission

methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the Role mention rather than the Role object.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: The evaluated permissions number

properties.name: managed

properties.name: hexColor
properties.description: The hexadecimal version of the role color, with a leading hashtag.

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// start typing in a channel
channel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// stop typing in a channel
channel.stopTyping();

// force typing to fully stop in a channel
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description:
Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specified
filter.

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter function to use

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.
In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to compare this channel to

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description:
Gets the overall set of permissions for a user in this channel, taking into account roles and permission
overwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the overall permissions for

methods.name: overwritePermissions
methods.description: Overwrites the permissions for a user or role in this channel.

params.name: userOrRole
params.description: The user or role to update

params.name: options
params.description: The configuration for the update

params.name: topic

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the Channel's mention instead of the Channel object.
examples:
// Outputs: Hello from #general
console.log(`Hello from ${channel}`);

// Outputs: Hello from #general
console.log('Hello from ' + channel);

classes.name: User
classes.description: Represents a User on Discord.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the User's mention instead of the User object.
examples:
// logs: Hello from <@123456789>!
console.log(`Hello from ${user}!`);

methods.name: deleteDM
methods.description: Deletes a DM Channel (if one exists) between the Client and the User. Resolves with the Channel if successful.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if the user is equal to another. It compares username, ID, discriminator, status and the game being played.
It is recommended to compare equality by using `user.id === user2.id` unless you want to compare all properties.

params.name: user
params.description: The user to compare

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: attachment
params.description: The file to send

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

properties.name: username
properties.description: The username of the User

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the User

properties.name: discriminator
properties.description: A discriminator based on username for the User

properties.name: avatar
properties.description: The ID of the user's avatar

properties.name: bot
properties.description: Whether or not the User is a Bot.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
The status of the user:

* **`online`** - user is online
* **`offline`** - user is offline
* **`idle`** - user is AFK

properties.name: game
properties.description: The game that the user is playing, `null` if they aren't playing a game.

properties.name: avatarURL
properties.description: A link to the user's avatar (if they have one, otherwise null)

classes.name: VoiceChannel
classes.description: Represents a Server Voice Channel on Discord.

methods.name: setBitrate
methods.description: Sets the bitrate of the channel

params.name: bitrate
params.description: The new bitrate

methods.description: Attempts to join this Voice Channel

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Leaves this voice channel
examples:
// leave a voice channel
voiceChannel.leave();

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.
In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to compare this channel to

methods.name: permissionsFor
methods.description:
Gets the overall set of permissions for a user in this channel, taking into account roles and permission
overwrites.

params.name: member
params.description: The user that you want to obtain the overall permissions for

methods.name: overwritePermissions
methods.description: Overwrites the permissions for a user or role in this channel.

params.name: userOrRole
params.description: The user or role to update

params.name: options
params.description: The configuration for the update

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set a new name for the Guild Channel

params.name: name
params.description: The new name for the guild channel

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description: Set a new position for the Guild Channel

params.name: position
params.description: The new position for the guild channel

methods.name: setTopic
methods.description: Set a new topic for the Guild Channel

params.name: topic
params.description: The new topic for the guild channel

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the Channel's mention instead of the Channel object.
examples:
// Outputs: Hello from #general
console.log(`Hello from ${channel}`);

// Outputs: Hello from #general
console.log('Hello from ' + channel);

methods.name: createInvite
methods.description: Create an invite to this Guild Channel

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the invite

properties.name: members
properties.description: The members in this Voice Channel.

properties.name: bitrate
properties.description: The bitrate of this voice channel

properties.name: userLimit
properties.description: The maximum amount of users allowed in this channel - 0 means unlimited.

properties.name: topic
properties.description: The topic of the Guild Channel, if there is one.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the channel in the list.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the Guild Channel

properties.name: permissionOverwrites
properties.description: A map of permission overwrites in this channel for roles and users.

classes.name: Collection
classes.description: A utility class to help make it easier to access the data stores

methods.name: array
methods.description: Returns an ordered array of the values of this collection.
examples:
// identical to:
Array.from(collection.values());

methods.name: first
methods.description: Returns the first item in this collection.
examples:
// identical to:
Array.from(collection.values())[0];

methods.name: last
methods.description:
Returns the last item in this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,
since an array copy of the values must be made to find the last element.

methods.name: random
methods.description:
Returns a random item from this collection. This is a relatively slow operation,
since an array copy of the values must be made to find a random element.

methods.name: deleteAll
methods.description:
If the items in this collection have a delete method (e.g. messages), invoke
the delete method. Returns an array of promises

methods.name: findAll
methods.description: Returns an array of items where `item[key] === value` of the collection
examples: collection.getAll('username', 'Bob');

params.name: key
params.description: The key to filter by

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value

methods.name: find
methods.description: Returns a single item where `item[key] === value`
examples: collection.get('id', '123123...');

params.name: key
params.description: The key to filter by

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Returns true if the collection has an item where `item[key] === value`

params.name: key
params.description: The key to filter by

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value

methods.name: filter
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter),
but returns a Collection instead of an Array.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function used to filter (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to set as this when filtering

methods.name: map
methods.description: Functionally identical shortcut to `collection.array().map(...)`.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new Array, taking three arguments

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Optional. Value to use as this when executing callback.

interfaces.name: TextBasedChannel
interfaces.description: Interface for classes that have text-channel-like features

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk delete a given Collection or Array of messages in one go. Returns the deleted messages after.

params.name: messages
params.description: The messages to delete

methods.name: sendMessage
methods.description: Send a message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendTTSMessage
methods.description: Send a text-to-speech message to this channel

params.name: content
params.description: The content to send

params.name: options
params.description: The options to provide

methods.name: sendFile
methods.description: Send a file to this channel

params.name: attachment
params.description: The file to send

params.name: fileName
params.description: The name and extension of the file

methods.name: fetchMessages
methods.description: Gets the past messages sent in this channel. Resolves with a Collection mapping message ID's to Message objects.

params.name: options
params.description: The query parameters to pass in

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// start typing in a channel
channel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the Client User to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// stop typing in a channel
channel.stopTyping();

// force typing to fully stop in a channel
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter to create the collector with

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description:
Similar to createCollector but in Promise form. Resolves with a Collection of messages that pass the specified
filter.

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter function to use

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetches the pinned messages of this Channel and returns a Collection of them.

properties.name: messages
properties.description: A Collection containing the messages sent to this channel.

properties.name: typing
properties.description: Whether or not the typing indicator is being shown in the channel.

properties.name: typingCount
properties.description: Number of times `startTyping` has been called.

typedefs.name: UserResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a User object. This can be:
* A User object
* A User ID
* A Message (resolves to the message author)
* A Guild (owner of the guild)
* A Guild Member

typedefs.name: GuildResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Guild object. This can be:
* A Guild object

typedefs.name: GuildMemberResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a GuildMember object. This can be:
* A GuildMember object
* A User object

typedefs.name: Base64Resolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Base64 string, typically for image uploading. This can be:
* A Buffer
* A Base64 string

typedefs.name: ChannelResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a Channel. This can be:
* An instance of a Channel
* An ID of a Channel

typedefs.name: PermissionResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:
* A string
* A permission number

typedefs.name: StringResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a string. This can be:
* A string
* An Array (joined with a new line delimiter to give a string)
* Any value

typedefs.name: FileResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a Buffer. This can be:
* A Buffer
* The path to a local file
* A URL

typedefs.name: PermissionOverwriteOptions
typedefs.description:
An object mapping permission flags to `true` (enabled) or `false` (disabled)
```js
{
 'SEND_MESSAGES': true,
 'ATTACH_FILES': false,
}
```

typedefs.name: InviteOptions
typedefs.description:
Options given when creating a Guild Channel Invite:
```js
{
 temporary: false, // whether the invite should kick users after 24hrs if they are not given a new role
 maxAge: 0, // the time in seconds the invite expires in
 maxUses: 0, // the maximum amount of uses for this invite
}
```

typedefs.name: MessageOptions
ChannelLogsQueryOptions
typedefs.description:
The parameters to pass in when requesting previous messages from a channel. `around`, `before` and
`after` are mutually exclusive. All the parameters are optional.
```js
{
 limit: 30, // the message limit, defaults to 50
 before: '123', // gets messages before the given message ID
 after: '123', // gets messages after the given message ID
 around: '123', // gets messages around the given message ID
}
```

typedefs.name: AwaitMessagesOptions
CollectorFilterFunction
CollectorOptions
typedefs.description:
An object containing options used to configure a MessageCollector. All properties are optional.
```js
{
 time: null, // time in milliseconds. If specified, the collector ends after this amount of time.
 max: null, // the maximum amount of messages to handle before ending.
}
```

typedefs.name: ClientOptions

general.name: Welcome
general.data: [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/hydrabolt/discord.js.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/hydrabolt/discord.js) [![Documentation Status](https://readthedocs.org/projects/discordjs/badge/?version=latest)](http://discordjs.readthedocs.org/en/latest/?badge=latest) [![NPM](https://nodei.co/npm/discord.js.png?downloads=true&stars=true)](https://nodei.co/npm/discord.js/) # Welcome! Welcome to the discord.js rewrite documentation. The rewrite has taken a lot of time, but it should be much more stable and performance-friendly than previous versions. ## Installation `npm i --save hydrabolt/discord.js#indev-rewrite`

general.name: Updating your code
general.data:
# About the Rewrite
The rewrite takes a much more OOP approach than previous versions, which allows code to be much more manageable.
It's been rebuilt from the ground up and should be much more stable, fixing caching issues that affected
older versions and it also has support for new Discord Features, such as emojis.

## Upgrading your code
The rewrite has a _lot_ of breaking changes. Major methods, e.g. `client.sendMessage(channel, message)` have been moved
from the Client class towards their respective classes - `textChannel.sendMessage(message)`. You can find out the full
extent of these changes by looking at the classes in the documentation.

Additionally, some event names and parameters have changed - you should revisit these.

examples.name: Ping Pong
Avatars
